hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal on High-Frequency Order Book Imbalance
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 1-minute order book shows bid-ask spread widening by >0.15% AND cumulative bid depth within 0.5% of mid-price drops by >40% relative to ask depth (creating a liquidity gap), price will mean-revert to fill the gap within 5 minutes with >65% probability in NEUTRAL regimes.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Market makers and arbitrage bots actively fill liquidity gaps in neutral regimes where volatility is contained. Sudden one-sided liquidity depletion creates temporary pricing inefficiencies that institutional flow corrects.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-min bid-ask spread > 0.15% (normalized to 20-min rolling median)
Bid depth within 0.5% of mid-price < 60% of ask depth (bid/ask ratio < 0.6)
Price momentum negative over past 3 candles but RSI(14) > 30 (not oversold)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to volume-weighted midpoint of pre-gap 10-minute range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 0.25% beyond entry in direction of gap
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 minutes after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Gap persists >5 minutes OR price continues in direction of gap >70% of occurrences in backtest
